sentences.sentence: October 5, 2020 Ohio Governor Mike DeWine is a joke.
I should know, I live in Ohio and I have been living under his dictator rule since COVID-19 started.
He is supposed to be Republican, but he followed closely in line with Democratic governors, like Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer.
Over the weekend, DeWine mask shamed President Donald Trump, declaring that he hopes the POTUS' diagnosis is a "cautionary tale" for people who do not wear masks.

DeWine said, “I said this at a press conference I did the other day, this should be kind of an alert to everybody that anybody can get the virus, even president of the United States can get the virus.

So we ought to use this and simply just, you know, learn from it and so people who maybe have not worn masks in the past, you know, I’m hoping that they will look at this and say the president can get it, I can get it, and it can happen to anybody.
I hope that is what happens, and that is what comes out of this.

We pray for the president, and we pray for the first lady and everybody else who has the virus.” He added, “What I hope is that what we have seen with the president is a cautionary tale for people and people will understand, look, it can happen to the president, it can happen to you, and it can happen to your family.
You wear a mask to help other people.

And so if anything good can come out of this tragedy of the president and the White House, you know, we hope just people will look at that and say we need to wear a mask and this is what we need to do to slow this thing down.” @jaketapper that he has not been contacted by the White House about potential Covid-19 exposure in his state after President Trump tested positive for the virus days after his Cleveland debate.

https://t.co/fetkV8aDfq #CNNSOTU pic.twitter.com/Rb7jOxn4yr — State of the Union (@CNNSotu) October 4, 2020 Schumer: It's ‘Irresponsible and Dangerous to Move Forward’ with ACB SCOTUS Hearing Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer is calling for the Senate to postpone Judge Amy Coney Barrett's SCOTUS confirmation because it is “irresponsible and dangerous to move forward with a hearing” after two Judiciary Committee members tested positive for COVID-19.
“We now have two members of the Senate Judiciary Committee who have tested positive for COVID, and there may be more.
I wish my colleagues well,” he declared Friday night.
Being her usual classy self, Rep. Rashida Tlaib attacked President Donald Trump shortly after he and First Lady Melania Trump tested positive for COVID-19.
The "squad" member slammed the president, claiming that he only cares about himself and that lives have been lost because of his "deadly lies."
Continue reading… If former Vice President Joe Biden isn't careful about what he's doing, he's going to be broke very soon.
What I mean by that is that he's going to have some serious lawsuits against him that will cost him a lot of money.

Toward the end of September, Lin Wood, who is the attorney representing Kyle Rittenhouse, threatened a defamation lawsuit against Biden for attacking his client after a campaign ad he had which associated Rittenhouse with "white supremacists".
He gave Biden a warning to remove the ad...yet to this day, it stands.
Continue reading… During the first Presidential debate of 2020, President Trump and former Vice President Joe Biden started attacking each other very early on.
Sparks flew, punches were thrown (metaphorically, of course), but it was an entertaining debate when Chris Wallace kept his mouth shut long enough to let them speak.
It's sickening that they accuse President Trump of trying to rig the election when it is 100% clear that the left is pulling out every trick they have to try and rig it for themselves.
Continue reading… The long-awaited testimony from former FBI Director James Comey took place last week.

Of course, this isn't the first time that Comey has appeared in from of the Senate Judiciary Committee, but it is the first time since learning about just how much fakery was involved in the creation of the Steele dossier and obtaining the FISA warrants.
